ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course helped me to develop a habit of reading research articles, helped to improve scientific writing skills, helped to learn how to summarize the long research paper in two paragraphs i.e, how to write the abstract & conclusion, helped to improve teaching skills and explaining research to others using slides. This is really appreciable how this course has been designed on the basis of research papers, Pat used papers to explain almost every topic of enzyme kinetics which gives motivation to learn things that at some point during our research period these are going to be useful.

I got to know a lot more about enzymes! Also, the assignments introduced me to newer topics in the field. It improved my presentation and writing skills. The feedback from the instructor was really helpful.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: It covers a wide range of topics.
Not really a weakness but sometimes, I feel this course has a higher workload than other courses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yeasss because this is a useful course and they are definitely going to enjoy it a lot.
Yes. I think this course should be taken by every student who is interested in biophysical chemistry and chemical biology. Having a good understanding of enzyme chemistry is always a plus!
